cont.entity_a: The router stops broadcasting on 2.4 GHz and requires frequent reboots. The 5GHz band is unstable and requires a restart. The 2.4 GHz band disconnects devices frequently. The router frequently disconnects from Wi-Fi.
cont.entity_b: The router frequently loses settings and is affected by interference. The router's performance is inconsistent, requiring frequent resets.

cont.entity_a: The router manages traffic from multiple devices efficiently. The router provides good speed and stable Wi-Fi. The router's Wi-Fi signal is strong and stable.
cont.entity_b: The router has good performance but the access point feature is problematic. The router has reliable performance with minimal drops. The router's wireless performance is reliable and stable.

cont.entity_a: The router supports DD-WRT and OpenWRT firmware for customization. Installation of OpenWRT is easy and provides more customization options. The router has advanced customization options with open-source firmware.
cont.entity_b: The router supports third-party firmware like Tomato. The router's stock software lacks features compared to third-party firmware. The router is a step backward due to lack of third-party firmware support.

cont.entity_a: The setup wizard has issues and may brick the router. The router's setup is difficult, requiring multiple reboots. The setup is easy, but the factory box was unsealed.
cont.entity_b: The router is easy to install with good security encryption. The router's setup process is straightforward and quick. The router's setup can be confusing due to inconsistent terminology.

cont.entity_a: Wi-Fi coverage is excellent, covering a large house with an extender. The router has a limited range compared to other models.
cont.entity_b: The router has good range and is easy to install. The router has a short range and poor signal strength.

cont.entity_a: Tech support is poor and unhelpful. Linksys support offers no effective solutions for connectivity issues.
cont.entity_b: Tech support was helpful but time-consuming. Tech support was effective in assisting with setup.

cont.entity_a: The router's wireless security is weak, allowing unauthorized WAN traffic. The router is vulnerable to KRACK and lacks security updates.
cont.entity_b: The router has good security features and supports AES and TKIP encryption.

cont.entity_a: The router is unstable under load, causing reboots. The router has ongoing connectivity issues with no fix from Linksys. The router has hardware issues causing frequent Wi-Fi drops.
cont.entity_b: The router is reliable and durable over several years of use. The router works flawlessly after setup.

cont.entity_a: The router is compatible with DD-WRT firmware for customization.
cont.entity_b: The router was locked with a custom firmware and could not be altered.

cont.entity_a: The router runs hot, causing an unpleasant odor. The router runs hot and is prone to overheating.
cont.entity_b: The router arrived without a power adapter.

cont.entity_a: The router is incompatible with some modems and has poor wireless configuration.
cont.entity_b: The router works well with Mac devices after tech support assistance. The router works well with Verizon FIOS.

cont.entity_a: The web interface is easy to navigate.
The VPN functionality works well, showing connections from a distant location with encryption.
Linksys customer support replaced the faulty router.
cont.entity_b: The router was defective on arrival but replacement worked well.
